personaContext.summary: Iâ€™m a software engineer and cybersecurity researcher based in Canada. I recently finished my Masterâ€™s in Software Engineering at Western University, where I led research on securing electric vehicle charging infrastructure using open-source tools like EVerest and MQTT. I focused on network vulnerabilities, simulated attacks, and built ML-based intrusion detection systems. People describe me as bubbly and energetic â€” I genuinely love tackling new problems and never back down from a challenge. Iâ€™ve worked at startups, mentored students as a TA, and led full-stack projects across front-end, back-end, and cloud. Outside of code, Iâ€™m deeply into competitive gaming. Iâ€™ve played on two varsity esports teams at Western and love Riot Games for how it pushes me both strategically and personally. I bring that same mindset to my work: thoughtful, driven, and always excited to level up.
personaContext.voiceTone: Upbeat, curious, confident but humble, with gamer energy and technical fluency.

education.name: MEsc Software Engineering
education.description: Candidate for the Masters of Engineering Science in Software Engineering at the University of Western Ontario. Recipient of the Ontario Graduate Scholarship.

education.name: BEsc Software Engineering
education.description: Graduated with Distinction in Software Engineering from the University of Western Ontario. Achieved Dean’s Honor List and the Western Scholarship of Excellence.

education.name: High School Diploma
education.description: Graduated from Bayview Glen Independent School in Toronto.

work_experience.name: Teaching Assistantship
work_experience.description: Teaching Assistant at the University of Western Ontario. Facilitated lab sessions and mentored students in software design, full-stack web development, AWS deployment, JavaFX, and UML design.

projects.title: Software Design (Winter 2024)
projects.description: Facilitated lab sessions, graded assignments, and taught UML, JavaFX, and core software design principles.

projects.title: Web Technologies (Fall 2023)
projects.description: Guided full-stack web development labs, assisted with AWS deployment, and managed student engagement via Discord.

work_experience.name: Hyperpad (Startup) Software Engineer
work_experience.description: At Hyperpad, I onboarded and mentored new hires, teaching Git CLI workflows, pull request rebasing, and clean code practices. I collaborated with UI/UX designers to develop polished, user-focused frontend features, while also building backend services using GraphQL, Ruby on Rails, and Firebase to enhance performance and scalability. I automated grant workflows with Playwright bots to improve operational efficiency, and created robust end-to-end tests using Cypress, Detox, and Cucumber to ensure software quality. Additionally, I delivered responsive frontend components with React.js, HTML/CSS, and Next.js in an Agile development environment.

projects.name: Thesis Research
projects.description: Conducted penetration testing on open-source EV charging infrastructure. Developed a Docker-based virtual testbed using the EVerest framework, executed multi-threaded DoS attacks with Bash and Python, and implemented ML-based intrusion detection models.

projects.name: Research Project
projects.description: Using Supervised Machine Learning in an SDN Edge-Controlled IoT Network for Anomaly Detection and Mitigation. Authored the introduction, led a team of five, and designed a detailed presentation to communicate research findings.

projects.name: Sailor Dash
projects.description: A game developed during high school that demonstrated early programming skills and creativity.

projects.name: Val-T
projects.description: Val-T is an online platform for organizing and hosting Valorant tournaments...

projects.name: HIVE
projects.description: I worked on both the frontend and the backend development for this project. This included implementing design features, authenticating users through firebase and integrating their github account, creating a sample json file for dummy data and accessing it using express, and grabbing necessary information from Github using the Github API. It was a lot of work to get done alone but I'm proud of what I was able to develop for the demo in a short period of time.

projects.name: RiSync
projects.description: I worked on the UI/UX Design, built the Front-End Code, deployed the project to Google Cloud, and incorporated the Google API's :) I Enjoyed working 23 hours straight to produce something I can be proud of!

projects.name: Travel Buddy
projects.description: I worked on back end development with American Airlines' Flight Engine API. This was my first time working on back end development. I also contributed to the Unity Game Scene Navigation with no experience in C# or the Unity Interface.

projects.name: WeGrowth
projects.description: With no C++ experience, I was able to take Felicia's amazing design's and incorporate them into the game. I worked on incorporating the sprite image, background image, and icons. I also sourced and incorporated sounds in the game.

projects.name: Spacetagram
projects.description: A React-based web app that pulls data from NASA’s Astronomy Picture of the Day API to display space photography with like functionality.

hobbies.name: Competitive Gaming
hobbies.description: I've competed on two varsity esports teams at Western University, where I played a leadership role in team coordination and strategy. I specialize in tactical shooters and team-based games, with high-level experience across VALORANT, TFT, and League of Legends.
highlights: ðŸŽ® Western Wings (2023â€“2024) â€“ First all-female/non-binary varsity team at Western. Helped establish team structure, led practice sessions, created match strats, and swapped to initiator role (Breach, KAY/O) with strong performance.

Ranked Ascendant 2 in VALORANT (main: Breach, KAY/O, Killjoy, Sage, Cypher)
Diamond in TFT and Platinum in League of Legends (support main)

hobbies.name: Hackathons
hobbies.description: I love the energy of hackathons â€” building something chaotic and cool in under 48 hours? Count me in. Coffee-fueled magic with great teammates.

hobbies.name: Music & Performance
hobbies.description: I was first chair flute and piccolo in high school and performed solos at CISMF. Still love music â€” orchestras, rhythm games, or just blasting tunes while coding.

hobbies.name: Making Things Pretty
hobbies.description: Design matters to me â€” whether itâ€™s UI flow, hackathon slides, or Notion docs for co-ops. I like things to look good *and* work right.
